column5: Im looking now and need something quick for the ice season. Please offer some input on what units you like/dislike, why etc. it doesnt need to be the cats a**, but i want something reliable and usable in relitively shallow water (12-15 fow), but good up to 100+ for lakers. Thanks in advance for any input
I hear that CTC has the Lowrance Elite 4x Ice COMBO on sale at some stores for $279.  Might be worth a look as it come with both transducers.  I don't have one, just relaying a possible deal...
Not me but I WANT one too now.  LOL.  I just bought fisherpete's unit for the ice but I need a new unit in the boat (it's an old Paranamax 128 in there now) so it would be ideal for me.
I almost bought that unit today. Controls seem a hassle, bit i think ill grab it nonetheless
If you don't like it and DO buy it and I miss the sale maybe we can work a deal...
Deal.  Sure that's one HELL of a cab ride there but I'll come and I WILL bring some of my smoked walleye provided I have some.  If not, then something else, lol
I have the lowrance elite 5 and it's a great unit except for water over 70' - then i have a hard time marking my jig for lakers. Hope u have better luck than me.
So.....i told you about a month ago to get an elite4......what...you don't trust my advice?
